--- title: "Environmental and Demographic Analysis of Pittsburgh" subtitle: "INFO 526 - Fall 2023 - Project" author: "Team Uchihas" title-slide-attributes: data-background-size: stretch data-background-opacity: "0.7" data-slide-number: none format: revealjs: theme: ['data/customtheming.scss'] editor: visual execute: echo: false --- ## Project Overview ::: {style="text-align: center;font-size: 45px;"}
  • Compare the impact of NO2 and SO2 on hospital admissions, identifying the pollutant with the strongest correlation.
  • Analyze how air pollution affects different age groups and specific health conditions, such as respiratory diseases.
  • Visualize geographic disparities in health impacts using a heatmap, highlighting areas most vulnerable to air pollution.
::: ## Why It Matters: ::: {style="text-align: center;font-size: 45px;"}
  • Understanding the effects of NO2 and SO2 on hospital admissions helps shape more effective pollutant-specific health interventions.
  • Analyzing how these pollutants impact different age groups enables targeted public health strategies for vulnerable populations.
  • Assessing the impact of these pollutants on different areas across the city helps allocate medical resources more effectively.
::: ## What is our data? ::: {style="text-align: center;font-size: 45px;"}
  • The data includes NO2 and SO2 concentration levels across Pittsburgh neighborhoods, grouped by city blocks.
  • It tracks hospital admissions for respiratory and cardiovascular illnesses, categorized by specific health conditions.
  • Demographic information helps identify vulnerable populations affected by air pollution across different city blocks.
::: ## ::: panel-tabset #### Objective

Research Question

 ::: {style="text-align: center;font-size: 60px;"}

*How does NO2 and SO2 concentration impact hospital admissions for respiratory conditions across different block groups?*

::: #### Visualization ::: columns ::: {.column width="15%"} ::: ::: {.column width="80%"} ![](images/pollutant_animation.gif) ::: ::: {.column width="5%"} ::: ::: #### Discoveries

Insights Derived

 ::: {style="text-align: center;font-size: 45px;"}
  • A positive correlation was observed between higher NO₂ and SO₂ concentrations and increased hospital admissions for respiratory conditions.
  • Block groups near industrial zones exhibited the highest pollutant levels and hospital admissions, suggesting environmental and health inequities.
::: ::: ## ::: panel-tabset #### Objective

Research Question

 ::: {style="text-align: center;font-size: 60px;"}

*Understanding the Impact of Gas Concentrations on certain Age groups.*

::: #### Visualization ::: columns ::: {.column width="15%"} ::: ::: {.column width="80%"} ![](images/demographic_image.gif) ::: ::: {.column width="5%"} ::: ::: #### Discoveries

Insights Derived

 ::: {style="text-align: center;font-size: 45px;"}
  • Certain block groups have significantly higher gas exposure risks.
  • Targeted interventions can be implemented to reduce health impacts.
::: ::: ## ::: panel-tabset #### Analysis ::: {style="text-align: center;font-size: 60px;"}

*Visualize geographic disparities in health impacts to identify areas most vulnerable to air pollution using a heatmap?*

::: #### Visualization ::: columns ::: {.column width="15%"} ::: ::: {.column width="80%"} ![](images/heatmap_image.png) ::: ::: {.column width="5%"} ::: ::: #### Discoveries

Insights Derived

 ::: {style="text-align: center;font-size: 45px;"}
  • This visualization shows vulnerable populations in areas with high pollution, highlighting differences in exposure to harmful pollutants.
  • It emphasizes the need for targeted interventions to protect communities most at risk..
::: ::: ## Conclusion ::: {style="text-align: center;font-size: 45px;"}
  • The study connects NO₂ and SO₂ pollution to higher respiratory health risks, particularly in urban and industrial areas.
  • Vulnerable groups, such as children and the elderly, suffer more from pollution’s health effects.
  • The visual insights highlight the need for focused healthcare measures, improved zoning regulations, and cleaner industrial practices to reduce health disparities.
::: ## Thankyou ?

<script>
  // htmlwidgets need to know to resize themselves when slides are shown/hidden.
  // Fire the "slideenter" event (handled by htmlwidgets.js) when the current
  // slide changes (different for each slide format).
  (function () {
    // dispatch for htmlwidgets
    function fireSlideEnter() {
      const event = window.document.createEvent("Event");
      event.initEvent("slideenter", true, true);
      window.document.dispatchEvent(event);
    }

    function fireSlideChanged(previousSlide, currentSlide) {
      fireSlideEnter();

      // dispatch for shiny
      if (window.jQuery) {
        if (previousSlide) {
          window.jQuery(previousSlide).trigger("hidden");
        }
        if (currentSlide) {
          window.jQuery(currentSlide).trigger("shown");
        }
      }
    }

    // hookup for slidy
    if (window.w3c_slidy) {
      window.w3c_slidy.add_observer(function (slide_num) {
        // slide_num starts at position 1
        fireSlideChanged(null, w3c_slidy.slides[slide_num - 1]);
      });
    }

  })();
</script>
